column4: Fitch Revises Abbott Laboratories' Rating Outlook to Negative from Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  May 20 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed the ratings and revised  Abbott Laboratories' (ABT/Abbott) Rating Outlook to Negative from Stable. The  rating action follows ABT's announced agreement to acquire CFR Pharmaceuticals  (CFRP) for approximately $2.9 billion in cash and the assumption of roughly $500  million of CFRP gross debt. Fitch has affirmed the company's ratings  including the long-term Issuer Default  Rating (IDR)

column4: UPDATE 1-Wells Fargo hopes to double payout to investors -CFO
column5: May 20 Wells Fargo & Co plans to return as much as 75 percent of its profit to shareholders  up from 34 percent in 2013  a top executive said on Tuesday.

column4: BRIEF-Wells Fargo sets higher margin target for wealth unit
column5: May 20 Wells Fargo & Co 's Wealth  Brokerage and Retirement executive David Carroll said on Tuesday at the bank's investor day:  * The unit is increasing its target for pretax margin to 25% from 22% previously

column4: BRIEF-Wells Fargo mortgage unit to be profitable in '14

column4: ON THE MOVE-Disgruntled Wells Fargo team jumps to Raymond James
column5: NEW YORK  May 20 Robert J. Wood  a financial adviser with Wells Fargo Advisors  said on Tuesday he jumped with two other brokers to Raymond James Financial in Richmond  Va.  last Friday because of frustration over pressure to sell Wells Fargo & Co bank products.

column4: Wells Fargo is looking to pay out more to investors - CFO
column5: May 20 Wells Fargo & Co plans to return as much as 75 percent of its profits to shareholders  up from 34 percent in 2013  a top executive said on Tuesday.

column4: BRIEF-Wells Fargo updates payout targets
column5: May 20 Wells Fargo & Co chief financial officer John Shrewsberry said on Tuesday at the bank's investor day:  * Wells Fargo will target a net payout ratio of between 55 and 75 percent  * The bank's net payout ratio in 2013 was 34 percent  * Net payout ratio includes common stock dividends and share repurchases minus

column4: PRECIOUS-Platinum extends gains on South African strikes; gold firm
column5: SINGAPORE  May 20 Platinum extended gains to a second session on Tuesday as labour strikes at top producer South Africa continued into a 17th week  disrupting supply of about 40 percent of global output.     Gold held below $1 300 an ounce as a lack of major economic data and significant developments in geopolitical tensions in Ukraine kept investor interest muted.          FUNDAMENTALS     * Spot gold was steady at $1 293.04 an ounce by 0024 GMT. Platinum rose 0.3 percent to $1 468.

column4: Books covered for Saga's 550 mln stg primary offering - sources
column5: UK holiday-to-insurance firm Saga has covered the books for the 550 million pounds ($926.67 million) of new shares it is issuing in its London initial public offering  two sources familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.
